habits.text: A habit cannot be tossed out the window; it must be coaxed down the stairs a step at a time.
habits.author: Mark Twain

habits.text: Discipline is choosing between what you want now and what you want most.
habits.author: Abraham Lincoln

habits.text: Feeling sorry for yourself, and your present condition is not only a waste of energy but the worst habit you could possibly have.
habits.author: Dale Carnegie

habits.text: Good habits formed at youth make all the difference.
habits.author: Aristotle

habits.text: Let today be the day you give up who you've been for who you can become.
habits.author: Hal Elrod

habits.text: Success is the sum of small efforts repeated day in and day out.
habits.author: Robert Collier

habits.text: In essence, if we want to direct our lives, we must take control of our consistent actions.It's not what we do once in a while that shapes our lives, but what we do consistently.
habits.author: Tony Robbins

habits.text: Your net worth to the world is usually determined by what remains after your bad habits are subtracted from your good ones.
habits.author: Benjamin Franklin

habits.text: Motivation is what gets you started. Habit is what keeps you going.
habits.author: Jim Rohn

habits.text: And once you understand that habits can change, you have the freedom and the responsibility to remake them.
habits.author: Charles Duhigg

skills.text: Schooling doesn't assure employment but skill does.
skills.author: Amit Kalantri

skills.text: Paper qualification is no longer enough in today’s competitive society. You need skills that people will pay for.
skills.author: Emi Iyalla

skills.text: Success in management requires learning as fast as the world is changing.
skills.author: Warren Bennis

skills.text: You don’t learn to walk by following rules. You learn by doing, and by falling over.
skills.author: Richard Branson

skills.text: Anyone who stops learning is old, whether at twenty or eighty. Anyone who keeps learning stays young.
skills.author: Henry Ford

skills.text: I fear not the man who has practiced 10,000 kicks once, but I fear the man who has practiced one kick 10,000 times.
skills.author: Bruce Lee

skills.text: Tell me and I forget. Teach me and I remember. Involve me and I learn.
skills.author: Benjamin Frankin

skills.text: In learning you will teach, and in teaching you will learn.
skills.author: Phil Collins

skills.text: The beautiful thing about learning is that nobody can take it away from you.
skills.author: B.B. King

skills.text: I am always doing that which I cannot do, in order that I may learn how to do it.
skills.author: Pablo Picasso
